intro: [WRONG START] Triticem vulgare convar. muticum, commonly known as smooth wheat, is a variant of common wheat characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and stems. It is a herbaceous annual plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae, and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with dense, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, two-lobed florets. Its botanical features include hollow, cylindrical stems and leaves that are usually narrow and parallel-veined. This variety is often cultivated for its grain, which is used in the production of bread and other cereal-based foods.
